channel.title: STA 199: Intro to Data Science on STA 199
channel.description: Recent content in STA 199: Intro to Data Science on STA 199

item.description: Policies code{white-space: pre;} pre:not([class]) { background-color: white; } if (window.hljs) { hljs.configure({languages: []}); hljs.initHighlightingOnLoad(); if (document.readyState && document.readyState === "complete") { window.setTimeout(function() { hljs.initHighlighting(); }, 0); } } h1 { font-size: 34px; } h1.title { font-size: 38px; } h2 { font-size: 30px; } h3 { font-size: 24px; } h4 { font-size: 18px; } h5 { font-size: 16px; } h6 { font-size: 12px; } .

Note: This schedule may be updated as the semester progresses. Due dates for the exams and project will not be changed. Date Lesson Slides Reading Lab AE HW Exam Project Week 01 Tue, Aug 27 Welcome to Data Science Thu, Aug 29 Meet the Toolkit Fri, Aug 30 Lab 01 UNIT 1 Collecting, wrangling, & visualizing data Week 02 Tue, Sep 3 Fundamentals of data & data visualization Thu, Sep 5 Tidy data & data wrangling Fri, Sep 6 Lab 02 Week 03 Tue, Sep 10 Effective data visualization, Part 1 Thu, Sep 12 Confounding variables & Simpson's paradox Fri, Sep 13 Lab 03 Week 04 Tue, Sep 17 Effective data visualization, Part 2 Thu, Sep 19 Coding style + data types + recoding variables Fri, Sep 20 Lab 04 Week 05 Tue, Sep 24 Recap Thu, Sep 26 Functions and automation Fri, Sep 27 Lab 05 Week 06 Tue, Oct 1 Data ethics Exam 01 assigned Thu, Oct 3 TBD Fri, Oct 4 Work on Exam 01 Exam 01 due Week 07 Tue, Oct 8 NO CLASS - Fall Break UNIT 2 Modeling relationships between variables Thu, Oct 10 Language of models Fri, Oct 11 Project Lab Week 08 Tue, Oct 15 Formalizing linear models Thu, Oct 17 Modeling nonlinear relationships + multiple predictors Fri, Oct 18 Lab 06 Week 09 Tue, Oct 22 Multiple linear regression + model selection Thu, Oct 24 Prediction + model validation Fri, Oct 25 Lab 07 UNIT 3 Making rigorous conclusions Week 10 Tue, Oct 29 Estimation via bootstrapping Thu, Oct 31 Estimation via bootstrapping Fri, Nov 1 Lab 08 Week 11 Tue, Nov 5 Hypothesis testing via simulation methods, Part 1 Thu, Nov 7 Hypothesis testing via simulation methods, Part 2 Fri, Nov 8 Lab 09 Week 12 Tue, Nov 12 Inference via Central Limit Theorem, Part 1 Thu, Nov 14 Inference via Central Limit Theorem, Part 2 Fri, Nov 15 Project Lab Week 13 Tue, Nov 19 Inference for regression Exam 02 assigned Thu, Nov 21 Inference for regression Fri, Nov 22 Work on Exam Exam 02 due Week 14 Tue, Nov 26 Text analysis Thu, Nov 28 NO CLASS - Thanksgiving Break Fri, Nov 29 NO LAB - Thanksgiving Break UNIT 4 Looking forward Week 15 Tue, Dec 3 Interactive data visualization and reporting, Part 1 Thu, Dec 5 Interactive data visualization and reporting, Part 2 Fri, Dec 6 Lab 10 Final Exam Period Sat, Dec 14 Project presentations

item.title: Policies
item.description: Course Learning Objectives Learn to explore, visualize, and analyze data in a reproducible and shareable manner Gain experience in data wrangling and munging, exploratory data analysis, predictive modeling, and data visualization Work on problems and case studies inspired by and based on real-world questions and data Learn to effectively communicate results through written assignments and final project presentation Activities & Assessments The following activities and assessments will help you successfully achieve the course learning objectives.
